intro: Galium schmidii, commonly known as Schmid's bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. Galium schmidii thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands.
